result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane T Shillcox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

Defendant may not possess/consume any alcohol.

Defendant may not enter into any bar/tavern.
Defendant must must successfully complete anger management program.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
All other conditions the same as count 1.
Concurrent with: Count 1

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane T Shillcox

records.addlTxt: Jury trial on October 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shane T Shillcox in court with attorney Nick G Cirilli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:11 PM. Cirilli indicates the matter is not resolved and updates court on the status of the case. State recites offers. First offer: plead to both counts, costs on each count, 18 months probation, AODA. Second offer -  plead to both counts 60 days jail to each count, concurrent. Shillcox understands what the offers were and rejects both offers. Bond continued. Cirilli indicates they may be able to work something out today and asks court if it could be recalled today. Court will accept offer today if they can agree.  Jury trial scheduled for October 6, 2016 at 08:30 am. Recalled at 3:23 PM with same appeaances, defendant would be pleadaing G to counts #1 and #2 as alleged, withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months with conditions of: court costs on each count, have complied with victim notification requirements, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bar or tavern, maintain/obtain full time employment/school. Shillcox and Cirilli agree. Shillcox pleads G to counts #1 and #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty. State makes final statement and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Cirilli makes statement and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Shillcox makes statement, remorseful. Court proceeds to sentencing: Count 1 & 2 - with hold sentence and place on probation for 18 months with conditions: costs on each count, AODA and follow through with recommendations, FT emp/schooling, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into bars or taverns, must successfully complete anger management program. Must submit DNA sample today and expunction of DNA verbage. Appeal rights given.
Final pre-trial on July 8, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Shane T Shillcox in court with attorney Nick G Cirilli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:57 AM. Cirilli and Shillcox have complaint, waives reading, enters NG pleas. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 8, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on May 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Shane T Shillcox in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:20 AM. Court asks the defendant why he does not have an attorney today. Shillcox explains, would like to meet with the DA's office but was told he could not meet with him until May. Court considers changing bond to cash bond for stated reasons. Shillcox does not believe he is eligible for SPD. Court informs the defendant that he can waive his right to attorney. Court will allow one more adjournment. Shillcox will waive his right to an attorney, recess to fill out that form (9:25 AM). Recalled at 9:39 AM. Court has waiver of right to attorney form, goes thru it, defendant has changed his mind and will now fill out court appointed attorney form. Recess at 9:42 AM. Recalled at 9:49 AM. Court instructs the defendant what is needed to file the no contact provision on the bond, informs Court that he receives mail at the P.O. Box 66, Armstrong Crerek, WI  54113. Court has court appointed paper work, reviews it, will appoint an attorney, must pay back at the rate of $100.00 month commencing 5/15/16, sets for AIA on 5/23/16 at 9:00 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 20, 2016 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Shane T Shillcox in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:38 AM. State provides defenant with complaint in Court. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Shilcox understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, can hire his own. Court continues bond, instructs on contacting SPD and given court appointed paperwork, sets for AIA.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 09:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Shane T Shillcox
Current: P.O. Box 66, Armstrong Creek, WI 54103 United States  (Effective: 04-06-2016)
Prior: W14743 Us Highway 8, Goodman, WI 54125
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with victim JL
